prompt: <description>**CAD Modeling Instructions** **<part\\_1> - Cylindrical Object** The first part of the CAD assembly is a cylindrical object with a curved, metallic surface and a hollow interior. The object is symmetrical along its central axis, with a slightly tapered base and a wider top. The overall length of the object is approximately three times its width. 1. **Create a new coordinate system** At the origin, set the Euler angles to [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] degrees and the translation vector to [0.0154, 0.0123, 0.0]. 2. **Draw the 2D sketch for the base of the object** Create a new sketch on the X-Y plane of the coordinate system. 1. **Create Line 1** Starting at the point [0.0, 0.4813], draw a line to the point [0.0369, 0.4813]. 2. **Create Arc 1** Starting at the point [0.0369, 0.4813], draw an arc to the point [0.6824, 0.4813] with the midpoint at [0.3596, 0.0424]. 3. **Create Line 2** Starting at the point [0.6824, 0.4813], draw a line to the point [0.7193, 0.4813]. 4. **Create Arc 2** Starting at the point [0.7193, 0.4813], draw an arc to the point [0.0, 0.4813] with the midpoint at [0.3596, 0.0]. This loop forms a closed shape, which represents the base of the object. 3. **Scale the 2D sketch** Apply a scaling factor of 0.7193 to the entire sketch. 4. **Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D Sketch** Extrude the sketch along the normal vector by a depth of 0.0123 units. This will create a 3D solid object. 5. **Finalize the CAD model** The length, width, and height of the finished CAD model for part 1 will be as follows: - Length: ~0.7193 units - Width: ~0.0123 units - Height: ~0.7193 units Save this part and prepare for the next step in the CAD assembly.</description>
